solution_line_template: The total money Jerry needs to make for {num_days_work} days to get ${desired_average_per_night} per night is {num_days_work} nights * ${desired_average_per_night}/night = $<<{num_days_work}*{desired_average_per_night}={total_needed_for_average}>>{total_needed_for_average}.
His total earnings for the past four days is ${tip1} + ${tip2} + ${tip3} + ${tip4} = $<<{tip1}+{tip2}+{tip3}+{tip4}={total_earned_past_four_nights}>>{total_earned_past_four_nights}.

So, Jerry needs to earn ${total_needed_for_average} - ${total_earned_past_four_nights} = $<<{total_needed_for_average}-{total_earned_past_four_nights}={needed_tonight}>>{needed_tonight} in tips tonight.
